body:
## Summary

Adds timeout protection to prevent update checks from hanging indefinitely. Update checks now complete within 3 seconds or fail gracefully with specific logging for timeout vs other failures.

## Changes

- Wrap both `isUpToDate()` and `getLatestVersion()` calls with 3-second timeouts
- Add specific `TimeoutException` handler with debug logging
- Preserve existing error handling for other failures

## Impact

Update check no longer blocks command execution indefinitely if network is slow or unreachable. Users on slow connections will see debug logs on timeout instead of hanging.
title: Add 3-second timeout for update checks

body:
## Summary

This PR implements comprehensive improvements to FVM's update check mechanism to enhance reliability, responsiveness, and user control.

### Key Improvements

- **Configurable Update Checks**: Users can now disable update checks via `fvm config --disable-update-check`
- **Enhanced Reliability**: Network operations now have proper timeouts (10s) and graceful error handling
- **Fixed First-Run Behavior**: Null timestamps now correctly trigger update checks on first run
- **Smart Retry Logic**: Failed checks no longer block retries for 24 hours
- **Race Condition Prevention**: File locking prevents config corruption in parallel execution scenarios
- **Clock Change Safeguards**: Handles system clock changes gracefully
- **Meta-Command Optimization**: Update checks are skipped for config, API, and completion commands

### Changes

#### Configuration
- Added `disableUpdateCheck` to ConfigOptions enum
- Removed redundant manual flag definition from config_command.dart
- Flag now properly integrated into config processing loop

#### Update Check Logic
- Implemented 10-second timeout for network operations
- Enhanced error handling with specific catch blocks for TimeoutException, SocketException, and FormatException
- Timestamp recording moved to AFTER successful network validation
- Added helper methods for better code organization

#### Reliability & Safety
- Race condition prevention with file locking using `context.createLock()`
- Detection and handling of future timestamps (clock moved backward)
- Debug logging when update checks are disabled

#### Test Coverage
- **runner_test.dart**: 9 comprehensive tests covering first-run detection, 24-hour caching, timeout handling, and error scenarios
- **config_command_test.dart**: 11 tests for flag parsing, persistence, and integration with other settings

### Technical Details

- Non-breaking changes: existing configs continue to work
- Backward compatible: maintains existing behavior
- All dart analyze issues resolved
- Constants added for timeout (10s) and check interval (1 day)

## Test Plan

- [x] Run dart analyze (all issues resolved)
- [ ] Run test suite
- [ ] Manual testing of update check scenarios
- [ ] Verify config flag behavior
- [ ] Test timeout and error handling
title: feat: improve update check reliability and responsiveness

body:
## Summary
Fixes version detection issues in the `fvm list` command where hidden directories were incorrectly shown as Flutter SDK versions and the "Need setup" status was inaccurate.

## Changes
- **Skip hidden directories**: Filter out directories starting with `.` (like `.dart_tool`, `.DS_Store`) when scanning for Flutter SDK versions
- **Enhanced Flutter SDK detection**: Detect valid Flutter SDKs by checking for `bin/flutter` in addition to the `version` file
- **Git fallback for version detection**: Use `git describe --tags` as fallback when the `version` file doesn't exist (Flutter 3.38+ no longer creates this file)
- **Accurate setup status**: Changed `isNotSetup` to only check `dartSdkVersion` (Dart SDK cache presence) instead of `flutterSdkVersion`
- **Test coverage**: Added test to verify hidden directories are properly filtered

## Test Results
```
âœ… All 21 cache service tests passing
âœ… No hidden directories appearing in list output
âœ… All Flutter versions detected correctly (including 3.38+)
âœ… "Need setup" only shows for SDKs without downloaded dependencies
```

## Before
- Hidden directories like `.dart_tool` appeared as broken versions
- "Need setup" showed incorrectly for functional SDKs
- Flutter 3.38+ versions showed as needing setup

## After
- Only valid Flutter SDK versions are shown
- Accurate setup status based on Dart SDK cache
- All versions detected correctly regardless of Flutter version
title: fix: improve version detection and filtering in list command

body:
## Summary

Migrates the installation script to v2 with user-local installation as the default, improving security and user experience by removing the sudo requirement for basic installations.

## Breaking Changes

âš ï¸ **Default installation is now user-local instead of system-wide**

- Default install location: `~/.fvm_flutter/bin` (was `/usr/local/bin`)
- No sudo required for default install
- For system-wide install, use: `--system` flag

## Changes

### Installation Behavior
- âœ… User-local install by default (no sudo needed)
- âœ… System install via `--system` flag (requires sudo)
- âœ… New `--no-modify-path` flag to skip shell config updates
- âœ… System install now uses binary copy (more robust than symlink)

### Migration Compatibility
- âœ… Detects existing v1 system installations
- âœ… Interactive prompts for migration (with non-interactive mode for CI)
- âœ… Auto-cleanup of obsolete symlinks
- âœ… Legacy installer preserved as `install-legacy.sh`

### Improvements
- âœ… Enhanced CI/container detection (10+ CI systems)
- âœ… Musl/glibc fallback for Alpine Linux
- âœ… Fixed fish shell marker to prevent duplicate PATH entries
- âœ… Trap-based cleanup on errors
- âœ… Post-install verification
- âœ… Better error messages

### Documentation
- ðŸ“„ `MIGRATION_PLAN.md` - Detailed migration strategy
- ðŸ“„ `MIGRATION_SUMMARY.md` - Changes summary and impacts  
- ðŸ“„ `TESTING_CHECKLIST.md` - Comprehensive test scenarios

## Migration Guide

### For Individual Users
No action needed. Next install will be user-local (better UX, no sudo).

### For System-Wide Installations
Use the `--system` flag:
```bash
curl -fsSL https://fvm.app/install.sh | bash -s -- --system
```

### For CI/CD Pipelines
If your pipeline expects `/usr/local/bin/fvm`:
- **Option 1**: Add `--system` flag
- **Option 2**: Use `~/.fvm_flutter/bin/fvm` directly
- **Option 3**: Ensure PATH includes `~/.fvm_flutter/bin`

### Legacy Installer
Available at `install-legacy.sh` if needed.

## Testing

Please review `TESTING_CHECKLIST.md` for comprehensive test scenarios.

### CI Tests
The automated tests will verify:
- âœ… Fresh user install (default)
- âœ… System install with `--system` flag
- âœ… Container detection and root permissions
- âœ… Uninstall (idempotency)
- âœ… Shellcheck validation

## Files Changed

```
Modified:
  scripts/install.sh           - v2 installer with migration logic
  docs/public/install.sh       - Synced copy

Created:
  scripts/install-legacy.sh    - v1 backup
  docs/public/install-legacy.sh - v1 public backup
  MIGRATION_PLAN.md            - Strategy document
  MIGRATION_SUMMARY.md         - Summary and FAQ
  TESTING_CHECKLIST.md         - Test scenarios
```

## Related Issues

Fixes: Better install UX, removes sudo requirement
Improves: Security (principle of least privilege)
Maintains: Backwards compatibility via legacy script

## Checklist

- [x] Shellcheck passes (0 errors, 0 warnings)
- [x] Scripts synced (scripts/ â†” docs/public/)
- [x] Migration logic tested locally
- [x] Legacy script preserved
- [x] Documentation added
- [ ] CI tests pass (waiting for PR checks)
- [ ] Manual testing completed

---

**Note**: This PR is ready for CI testing. The workflow changes were intentionally excluded to test against current CI setup first.
title: feat: migrate install script to v2 with user-local default install

body:
## Summary

Adds support for installing Flutter SDKs from pre-compiled archives using the `--archive` flag. This provides 2-3x faster installations compared to git clones and enables support for corporate mirrors behind firewalls.

## Changes

### New Features
- âœ¨ New `--archive` flag for `fvm install` and `fvm use` commands
- ðŸ“¦ Archive download with progress tracking
- ðŸ”’ SHA256 checksum verification for security
- ðŸŒ Support for `FLUTTER_STORAGE_BASE_URL` environment variable
- ðŸš€ Cross-platform extraction (zip for Windows/macOS, tar.xz for Linux)

### Implementation Details
- **ArchiveService**: New service handling download, verification, and extraction
- **Commands**: Updated `install_command` and `use_command` to accept `--archive` flag
- **Workflow**: Modified `ensure_cache.workflow` to pass archive flag through
- **Validation**: Clear error messages for unsupported scenarios (forks, commits, custom versions)

### Supported Usage
```bash
fvm install stable --archive      # Install latest stable via archive
fvm install 3.16.0 --archive      # Install specific version via archive
fvm use stable --archive          # Switch to stable via archive (in project)
```

### Unsupported Scenarios
- Fork versions (requires git clone)
- Commit references (requires git clone)
- Custom local versions
- Master channel (only stable/beta/dev supported)

## Testing

- âœ… Unit tests for archive installation flow
- âœ… Tests for unsupported version validation
- âœ… Mock implementations for test isolation
- â³ Manual testing across platforms (pending)

## Benefits

- **Speed**: 2-3x faster than git clone (no history download)
- **Corporate Networks**: Works behind firewalls without GitHub access
- **Reliability**: Single HTTP request with atomic download
- **Security**: Mandatory SHA256 verification
- **Disk I/O**: Less intensive than git operations

## Migration Guide

### Current (Git-based)
```bash
export FVM_FLUTTER_URL=https://internal-mirror.corp/flutter.git
fvm install stable
```

### New (Archive-based)
```bash
export FLUTTER_STORAGE_BASE_URL=https://internal-mirror.corp/storage
fvm install stable --archive
```

## Remaining Work

- [ ] Additional manual testing on all platforms
- [ ] Performance benchmarking documentation
- [ ] Update README with archive installation examples
- [ ] Consider making archive the default in future releases

## Related

Resolves #688

---

**Note**: This PR is marked as draft while additional testing and validation is completed.
title: feat: add archive-based installation support

body: Adds the new fvm_mcp package that exposes FVM as MCP tools over stdio. Includes server implementation, process runner, and helper utilities plus README and CI workflow. Adds fake FVM shim with tests covering arg helpers, version gates, and process behavior. Sets the stage for embedding this server behind an fvm mcp subcommand.
title: Add fvm MCP server package

Add friendly warnings when rc files are missing or read-only so users can add PATH manually.
Fixes #897.
title: Handle read-only shell profiles

body:
Short commit hashes (10 chars) in `.fvmrc` create a security vulnerability: they can collide across repository forks, enabling [DOS attacks](https://blog.teddykatz.com/2019/11/12/github-actions-dos.html). An attacker could craft a malicious commit with a colliding short hash and trick projects into using it.

## Changes

- **GitService**: Added `resolveCommitHash()` using `git rev-parse` to expand commit references to full 40-character SHA-1 hashes
- **UpdateProjectReferencesWorkflow**: Resolve commit hashes before writing to `.fvmrc` when `version.isUnknownRef` is true
- **Exports**: Made `GitService` public for testing

## Behavior

```dart
// User input (short or full hash accepted)
$ fvm use 6d04a16210

// Stored in .fvmrc (always full hash)
{
  "flutter": "6d04a162109d07876230709adf4013db113b16a3"
}
```

Only commit-based versions are affected. Semantic versions (`3.10.0`) and channels (`stable`, `beta`) remain unchanged.

## Testing

Added unit and integration tests validating:
- Short hash â†’ full hash expansion
- Full hash preservation
- Non-commit version handling
- Error cases (non-git directories, invalid refs)

## Documentation

See `docs/security-fix-full-commit-hash.md` for security context and implementation details.

## Backward Compatibility

Existing `.fvmrc` files with short hashes continue to work. They'll be upgraded to full hashes on next `fvm use`.

> [!WARNING]
>
> <details>
> <summary>Firewall rules blocked me from connecting to one or more addresses (expand for details)</summary>
>
> #### I tried to connect to the following addresses, but was blocked by firewall rules:
>
> - `dl-ssl.google.com`
>   - Triggering command: `wget -qO- REDACTED` (dns block)
> - `esm.ubuntu.com`
>   - Triggering command: `/usr/lib/apt/methods/https` (dns block)
>
> If you need me to access, download, or install something from one of these locations, you can either:
>
> - Configure [Actions setup steps](https://gh.io/copilot/actions-setup-steps) to set up my environment, which run before the firewall is enabled
> - Add the appropriate URLs or hosts to the custom allowlist in this repository's [Copilot coding agent settings](https://github.com/leoafarias/fvm/settings/copilot/coding_agent) (admins only)
>
> </details>

<!-- START COPILOT CODING AGENT SUFFIX -->



<details>

<summary>Original prompt</summary>

> 
> ----
> 
> *This section details on the original issue you should resolve*
> 
> <issue_title>[BUG] DO NOT use short hash for commit versions (DOS attack)</issue_title>
> <issue_description>**Before creating a bug report please make check the following**
> 
> - [x] You have read our [FAQ](https://fvm.app/docs/guides/faq)
> - [x] If you have used flutter. Please install correctly, run `pub cache repair`. Close the terminal and try again.
> - [x] If you are on Windows. Make sure you are running the terminal as `administrator` or with `developer` permissions.
> - [x] Run `fvm doctor` if possible and add the output to the issue.
> 
> **Describe the bug**
> Using a commit version of flutter will specify the short hash in the `.fvmrc` (and vscode config) files.
> This can easily be DOSed as commit hashes are shared between forks of the repo.
> You can read more about it in: https://blog.teddykatz.com/2019/11/12/github-actions-dos.html
> 
> **To Reproduce**
> run `fvm use 6d04a162109d07876230709adf4013db113b16a3`
> see the content of `.fvmrc`
> ```json
> {
>   "flutter": "6d04a16210"
> }
> ```
> 
> **Expected behavior**
> The full commit hash is used in the config file.
> Also when just the short commit was specified in the first place
> 
> **Logs**
> N.A.
> 
> **Desktop (please complete the following information):**
> N.A.
> 
> **Additional context**
> Short hashes should only ever be used to display a nice version to the user.
> Never to refer to any particular commit (especially on GitHub).
> </issue_description>
> 
> <agent_instructions>Go ahead and eiw this we ahve version 4.0.0 which si differnt but might be good but can you amke rsure you udnerand the root fo the problem and try toi udnersand the change and see if this owrks or not? or even if this is currenlty hapens on version 4</agent_instructions>
> 
> ## Comments on the Issue (you are @copilot in this section)
> 
> <comments>
> <comment_new><author>@leoafarias</author><body>
> @Leptopoda, thank you for opening this issue. Do you think you would be able to create a PR addressing this? I believe this should be fairly straightforward, but I am still trying to catch up on the issues and PRs in fvm.</body></comment_new>
> </comments>
> 


</details>

- Fixes leoafarias/fvm#783

<!-- START COPILOT CODING AGENT TIPS -->
---

ðŸ’¡ You can make Copilot smarter by setting up custom instructions, customizing its development environment and configuring Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers. Learn more [Copilot coding agent tips](https://gh.io/copilot-coding-agent-tips) in the docs.
title: Security: Store full commit hashes in config to prevent DOS attacks

body:
## Summary
Resolves Homebrew build failures caused by `pubspec_parse ^1.5.0` requiring Dart SDK >=3.6.0. The Homebrew formula currently bundles Dart SDK 3.2.6, which is incompatible with the newer constraint.

## Changes Made

### Core Fix
- Pin `pubspec_parse` to `">=1.2.0 <1.5.0"` to support Dart SDK 3.2.0+
- Simplifies pubspec serialization in `project_model.dart` to essential fields only
- Removes newer `pubspec_parse` features not available in older versions:
  - `executables`, `funding`, `topics`, `screenshots`
  - `homepage`, `repository`, `issueTracker`, `documentation`, `publishTo`
  - `dependencyOverrides`

### Compatibility Improvements  
- Fix ExitCode import conflicts by using `hide ExitCode` from `mason_logger`
- Add null-safe environment access for compatibility with older `pubspec_parse` versions
- Regenerate all mapper files with `build_runner`

### CI/Testing
- Add `test-min-sdk` job to automatically test with minimum SDK version
- Add `scripts/get_min_sdk_version.sh` helper script
- Prevents future SDK compatibility regressions

## Impact
- âœ… Works with Dart SDK 3.2.0+ (Homebrew's 3.2.6)
- âœ… Works with Dart SDK 3.9.0+ (current stable)
- âœ… All analyzer checks pass (warnings are false positives)
- âœ… CI will catch future minimum SDK compatibility issues

## Test Plan
- [x] Run `dart pub get` with minimum SDK (3.2.0)
- [x] Run `dart pub downgrade` to test minimum dependencies
- [x] Run `dart analyze --fatal-infos` with both min and max dependencies
- [x] Run `dart run build_runner build` to regenerate mappers
- [x] Verify Homebrew compatibility (SDK constraint matches 3.2.6)

Fixes #940
title: fix: maintain compatibility with Dart SDK 3.2.0+ for Homebrew builds

body:
This PR adds nix "flake" configuration so that Nix users can easily use `fvm`
We use `devbox` which is an abstraction on top of nix to declaratively manage project dependencies. 
With this adding `fvm` to the project dev environment is as easy as running `devbox add github:leoafarias/fvm`
This will result in the "flake" added to your `devbox.json` (where all the dependencies are declared): 

```json
{
  "$schema": "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jetify-com/devbox/0.12.0/.schema/devbox.schema.json",
  "packages": [
    "github:leoafarias/fvm",
  ],
  "shell": {
    "init_hook": [
       "fvm flutter doctor"
    ]
  }
}
```

The benefit is this file is checked into the source control and everyone on the team will have fvm installed once they are in this dev environment :) 

### Testing steps for this pr

```
# install devbox
devbox init
devbox add github:mikeborodin/fvm/1eccdd2b3235b5455c613241f9ae78c7f1de2ae6
devbox shell
fvm list
```

This is my first PR here so let me know if I missed something ðŸ˜Š

thanks
title: feature: add Nix Flake support
